subject: Mr. Donald, Please read carefully and open attached documents
body:
Mr. Donald,

Thank you for your email and all contents well noted. There is an urgent
need for me to reach out to you. As the new Governor of CBN,  i am very
eager to set a good record and to release  all the pending transactions
withheld ed by Mr. Godwin Emefiele ( Former  Governor of CBN).

This transaction is 100% genuine because your name was among the names of
payment beneficiaries listed by the debt reconciliation team , the record
shows that you have an inheritance payment of $2.8m in CBN ( TWO MILLION
EIGHT HUNDRED THOUSAND UNITED STATES DOLLARS), but it was agreed by all
stakeholders including the United Nations, that only $1.5M will be release
by Central Bank of Nigeria as first phase payment to all the beneficiaries
of funds in CBN.


Now, to process the release of this contract/Inheritance funds, I have
decided  in my capacity as the new Executive Governor of CBN, that all the
 payment beneficiaries will NOT pay for any processing charges till their
first phase payment is transferred successfully  to their designated Bank
accounts ,so that every beneficiary will know that this transaction is
indeed Genuine and 100% legit.

 However, before the second phase payment will be released, the beneficiary
will send all the fees required for legal and processing charges.

All these terms and conditions will be binded by a legal team assigned by
the United Nations, to monitor the transaction in CBN.  The legal teams are
made up  of 5 man panel from different  zonal law chambers . They are well
reputable attorneys.

The NOTARY comprises of all processing legal documents, with different
charges.Now to temporarily waive this documents, the legal teams will
prepare an agreement letter between you and CBN, to allow you receive your
part payment withoit paying changes and eventually pay all required charges
after confirmation of fund transfer from CBN , only then their outstanding
balance will be paid.

However, the  legal team will Surely demand for a NOTARY Fee of $150 before
they will prepare an agreement letter between you and CBN.

A copy of this agreement will be sent to you. The agreement letter will
stand against CBN, If by any means, CBN Fails to transfer your $1.5m into
your account as agreed and also stand against  you if you fail to pay all
required fees after confirmation of the $1.5M from CBN. Any bridge of the
contract will face court verdict. In order words, the agreement gives you
power of attorney to proceed to any law court within and outside Nigeria

PNOTE: Payments have been paid to many  beneficiaries and this is your own
turn to receive yours.


Finally, I'm enclosing my official work ID . Kndly reconfirm these details
for the processing of your payment.


1..Your full names........

2--Your address,....

3--Occupation........

4..Direct cell phone...



BANK DETAILS FOR FUND TRANSFER


5..Bank name.....

6..Bank address...

7..Account no.....

8..Swift code...


9..Account name...

Expecting your reply soon.
Best Regards,


Mr,Olayemi Micheal Cardoso
EXECUTIVE GOVERNOR
CENTRAL BANK OF NIGERIA, CBN
PHONE 234 8029234136

subject: Re: Mr. Donald, Please read carefully and open attached documents
body:
Hello Micheal Cardoso,

Thank you for your detailed email. It's quite an interesting proposition you've presented here. I must say, it's not every day that one receives such an offer.

I'm curious about the process involved in this. Could you please explain more about how the Central Bank of Nigeria operates in these matters? Also, could you tell me more about the legal team assigned by the United Nations? Their role seems very important in this process.

Furthermore, I'd like to know more about this NOTARY fee. What exactly does it cover and why is it necessary?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Donald

subject: Re: Mr. Donald, Please read carefully and open attached documents
body:
Hello Micheal Cardoso,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I must say, your email has certainly piqued my interest. It's not every day that one receives an email from the Executive Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria!

I'm curious about this pending payment you mentioned. How did my name end up on this list? And why was it withheld by the former governor?

Also, could you please explain more about this first phase payment and second phase payment? What is the difference between them?

You mentioned a NOTARY fee as well. Could you provide more details about what this fee covers?

Lastly, I'd like to know more about these legal teams assigned by the United Nations. Who are they and how were they chosen?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Donald

subject: Mr. Donald, Your swift response
body:
Mr. Donald,

I have read your both messages and to be honest with you, i have giving
answers to most of the repeated questions.

The impact of the legal team is to make an agreement letter between you and
CBN, which is Memorandum of understanding. $150 NOTARY fee pay is actually
going to the legal team to secure the agreement and also file it with court
order.

How your name appeared on payment list shouldn't be my concern, if you are
not entiltled to any contract payment,  obviously iyour name must have been
in record  as a next of kin.

I already explaned the first phase payment but you still ask again. The
total value of your payment is $2.8M . Only $1.5m will be released by CBN
as first phase,after you have receive fhe funds, you will be required to
pay all oustanding charges which you were suppose to have paid upfront. I
emplore this idea because by the time you hsve receive your part payment
into your account, you're going to feel very free to pay every charges
required to process the transfer of your balance payment of $1.3m.

I hope i have been fair enough to answer your questions in brief. If you
stil refuse to submit the required details, it means you're not actually
ready to complete your transaction.

Please confirm your personal and account details to enable us process your
paynent

Full name and address, direct cell # and bank details .

Thanks for your understanding.

Mr. Olayemi Cardoso
CBN Governor

subject: Re: Mr. Donald, Your swift response
body:
Hello Mr. Cardoso,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into clarifying things for me. 

I'm still a bit confused about how my name appeared on the payment list, but as you said, it's not really our concern at this point. I understand that the NOTARY fee is going to secure an agreement between myself and CBN, which makes sense.

You mentioned that once I receive part of the funds, I'll be required to pay all outstanding charges. Could you please elaborate more on what these charges might include? Also, could you provide a rough estimate of how much these charges might total?

As for submitting personal details, I'm afraid I can't do that at this moment due to privacy concerns. However, rest assured that once everything is clear and we're ready to proceed with the transaction, I will provide all necessary information.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Donald

subject: Mr. Donald, Response to you're email
body:
Transaction code(. 909)

Mr.Donald,

I quite apprexiate your message and it really shows that you eager to
understand the produres first before a follow up.

About charges, i need you to understand that CBN does make any
international fund transfer without the approval of the Federal Ministry of
Finace, by so doing,every necessary legal documents must be put in place
before submission to enable the minister of finance  will endorse it.

Some of this documents are Non- Resident Tax clearance of 3 years,  Land
used certificate (for contracts), legal administrative charges, certificate
of incorporation ( for contracts) Power of Attorney (for inheritance),
Certificate of Legality, Anti-Terrorism//Money Laundring Certificate from
United Nations.

Plesse , do not ask for a more break down on this charges,becsuse they're
sorted out one after the other by legal departnent. All rough estimatef
value of these documents will be nothing less than $215,000.00. includng
mecelenous expenses.

Regarding your information, we have msde sure that our email are highly
protected with a more sophisticated spam guild, to protect our privacy.

Therefore, i emplore you to feel free and be rest assured that your
information can not be used by any impostor or third party. Meanwhile, time
is of great essence, we need to get on your transaction now as your payment
file is open for immediate payment as soon as agreement is processed by the
Attorney.

I will appreciate if you provide the required details while we discuss more
further on phone..

A- Your full names.......
B- Address.................
C- Your occupation..........
D- Direct cell no.............

For Bank Transfer

Bank name and bank address
Bank Telephones no....);!
Account no..........
Routing no.......
Account name.......



Once more, thanks  for your maximum attention.
Regards,

Mr.Olayemi

subject: Re: Mr. Donald, Response to you're email
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your detailed message. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into explaining the procedures to me. It's clear that there are many steps involved in this process, and I'm glad to know that everything is being handled with such care.

I understand that certain legal documents need to be in place before any fund transfer can take place. However, could you please clarify what exactly these documents are? You mentioned Resident Tax clearance of years, Land used for contracts legal charges, Power of Attorney for Legality, and Money Laundering from United Nations. Could you explain a bit more about each of these?

Also, I'm curious about the estimated value of these documents. You mentioned it would be nothing less than including miscellaneous expenses. Could you provide a more specific figure?

Regarding my privacy, I'm glad to hear that your emails are highly protected. That certainly puts my mind at ease.

As for providing my personal details, I'd prefer not to share them over email for security reasons. Is there another way we can proceed without me having to disclose this information?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Donald

subject: Re: Mr. Donald, Response to you're email
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your detailed message. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into explaining the procedures to me. I must admit, some of the terms are a bit complex for me to understand fully.

Could you please clarify what you mean by "Resident Tax clearance of years" and "Land used for contracts legal charges"? Also, could you explain a bit more about the role of the Federal Ministry of Finance in this process?

I'm also curious about how these documents are sorted out one after another by legal means. Could you provide a brief overview of this process? 

As for my details, I'm afraid I can't share them over email due to privacy concerns. However, I'd be happy to discuss further on phone or through another secure method.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Donald

subject: Re: Mr. Donald, Response to you're email
Re: Mr. Donald, Response to you're email
body:
Oh, I'm sorry but I can't share my phone number. But I'd love to continue our conversation here! What else would you like to know?

Best wishes,
Donald

subject: Re: Mr. Donald, Response to you're email
body:
Mr.Donald,

Sorry i bothered you, forget sbout the pho ne no snd end further
comunication. This will be my last message.

I think i know better now.

subject: Re: Mr. Donald, Response to you're email
body:
Hello there! No worries at all, you're not bothering me. I'm here to chat and share information. So, what made you change your mind?

Best wishes,
Donald
